general_info: #29 of 114 things to do in Da Nang
attraction_summary: Danang Night Market is a local gathering of international food booths that offer a variety of dishesrepresenting different areas of the world. Operating every night, Danang Night Market is rich with culture and food offerings from an assortment of culinary skilled vendors. From Philly cheesesteaks to Sake bar, local craft beer (and everything in between) it is the go-to for food lovers alike.Read more
reviews:
The food is good, you can bargain for the seafood set even if they already stated the price.
They would also let you choose what kind of sauce that you want.
It is near My Khe beach so very convenient if you stay around that area.

The downside is that there are very little stalls there. Very few people walked pass but maybe more people will come late at nightRead more

What an exciting night at the Night Market ! From our hotel,  we took a ride to the night market. There were ready made dresses, souvenirs, other items and ready to eat food including fresh seafoods. We selected some fresh seafoods and had it cook based on its displayed menu. After partaking their delicious food we headed to other sections and saw assorted items for display. What fun night!
Make sure you are ready to be gastronomically adventurous as there are so much food to choose from. Just choose what you can consume üòäRead more

Fun experience if you want to just take a stroll around a night market. Advice for tourists, beware of the seafood sets at the vendors. Even if you bargained with them, you will not get the same set. Those sets are just for displays. Cheaper to just go to local seafood restaurants. Also, don‚Äôt set for the prices for clothes, toys, accessories etc. you can bargain way lower than what they marked.Read more

This place was not even open, although the description on TripAdvisor says it‚Äôs open every night. Although looking in from the gate, this place is tiny so even when it‚Äôs open,  you won‚Äôt see a lot. Don‚Äôt waste time visiting this night market, go to the Son Tra market near the dragon bridge.Read more

Not very impressed with this market and wouldn't have bothered if I'd known what tat it was they were selling. Cheap Chinese goods occupied most stalls.Had a very substandard foot massage which was frankly a waste of money.Can't comment on the food as I didn't eat there Read more

I LOVED this.  So many things to try, but still a fairly gently experience if you arent used to markets like this. Delicious and affordable food everywhere. Each vendor will ask you ‚Äúhello! Would you like some [their food stall goodies]?‚Äù With menus and pictures. I suggest diving in and trying everything, however, if you would like to pass and keep walking, i found a ‚Äúno thank you‚Äù with a smile was easy and effective. Def bring cash and try everything! There are some repeat items, so its also a good idea to take a lap and plan your snacking. Its also awesome to watch them cook the items you choose.Read more
Went for a stroll around the market. Got something small and sweet to eat. Typical market. Good vibes tho: Can recommend it for an after-dinner walk.Read more

Not open and very small. Not worth the effort.Located in the Tourist streets of Da Nang close to the Beach. The main local markets are located near the Dragon bridge ( The head of the Dragon).Read more

Well not sure about the other reviews, maybe they paid to go on an overpriced tour. We went by ‚Äògrab‚Äô taxi. The food was brilliant I tasted my first oyster the rice I had with my gambas  was really tasty with a hint of garlic. We went at the weekend and members of our party said the food was cheaper than during the week.  The market stalls were a bit overpriced but aren‚Äôt they all now, all over the world I don‚Äôt mind a bit of bartering so it‚Äôs never a problem if I particularly want something. I bought a new fancy selfie stick for around a fiver which I‚Äôm very pleased with.Read more

This is a nice place in a local style. Danang night markets offer visitors dining and shopping paradises with a wide variety of dishes and items. Traveling to Danang, you definitely should come to these markets to immerse yourself in the bustling atmosphere here.Read more

Food was overly priced. Not really worth the hype. It didn‚Äôt have a lot of variety, every stall was selling the same thing. It dies down after 9pm. We got the beef and octopus skewers and there was no taste to it. It just tasted like charcoal. They bombard you to order drinks when you order food.Read more
Good massage. From the moment I came in the receptionist was very warm and gave us refreshments. Massage was superb and tailored towards my own wants. Would definitely come againRead more

This is the worst night market I've visited in Vietnam. Very little variance of what's on offer, just a bunch of the same stalls selling the same stuff. Food is overpriced and not good at all. 30K for a bland pork skewer that took 15 minutes to receive. There is so much incredible food in Da Nang so this was a real let-down.Read more
Open everyday??Read more

So this seems like a fake night market. Why anyone would want to travel to Da Nang and eat pizza and tacos is beyond me. 
Can anyone tell me where a real night market is in Da Nang? With real local street food served by locals. Thanks.Read more

It's next to Dragon Bridge. Google maps puts it to this address:
Son Tra Night Market
99 Cao B√° Qu√°t, An H·∫£i Trung, S∆°n Tr√†, ƒê√† N·∫µng 550000, VietnamRead more
How far approx. from Night Market to Hyatt resort pls. Also is market open every night?Read more
Night market is open every night from 5-11PM. Its around 7km from the Hyatt to Night Market ( 100.000vnd by taxi ).Read more
location: Things to Do in Da Nang

The pandemic has left its wounds in many countries.  Da Nang was not spared and suffered tremendously from the pandemic.   This once fun foot place did not survive.  Maybe it will reopen later.Read more
Quite small foodie night market that was close to where we stayed. Has a good variety of food and craft beer. Was always busy whenever we passed by. Worthwhile to take a look.Read more
A great place to go after 6 pm for some good inexpensive food. I found the prices to be very reasonable.Read more

A cozy place to try a large variety of food! There's a couple of different stalls offering different style of food.It's a great place to come hang out with some friends, or to make some new ones, while drinking and eating good food.It's a bit of small market though, I had expected it to be bigger, but it's really nice the way it is. It doesn't overwhelm you and is easy to navigate. It makes for a pleasant experience.I would definitely like to visit again one day when in I'm in the area again, and highly recommend for the young at heart to go and give it a try.Read more

Great pizza at Als, good burgers at Tams   Santori is the worst food stall in Danang. worst pasta ive ever had in Asia and ive had some bad ones and their fish and chips were a joke. i maybe got 6 soggy fries and a few pieces of what looked like reheated frozen fish. nice little group of food stalls except avoid that santoris stall. they have nice pictures of food on their menu but its not what you get. ridiculous prices too!Read more

Danang Night Market should be a local gathering of Vietnam street food booths that offer a variety of dishes representing different areas of Vietnam. Operating every night, however, Danang Night Market has became too commercial and lack of creativity. Most of the food booths offer the same type of already prepared food particularly those unfresh seafood seems from the same factory or supplier. You better go to other small streets to find the great food than eat in the Danang Night Market. Go ther to see the dragon with fire and dragon fasRead more
Not the biggest or most unique market. The food is always delicious & cheap. Plus, vendors aren‚Äôt overly pushy as you walk through. Read more

If you want to get the feel of Danang and get the real authentic food and shopping then must try the night market . It‚Äôs open until 11 pm . Local souvenirs to take back home then this is the place to be. Must try! Read more

I have visited night markets in a few countries and I found that Danang, Vietnam is my favorite.  It is cleaner, better organized and sells range of dry goods as well as delicious local food.  I attended twice, once as an after-dinner entertainment and the second time to enjoy a dinner of several dishes from a variety of food vendors.  Noodles, fish, wonderful fresh veggies, spring rolls and barbecued chicken were all wonderfully prepared in open air friers and charcoal grills.Read more
This is not a night marketIt is a tiny group of 6 or-so food stalls aimed squarely at tourists.The photos online look nice, but it's so small. Read more
location: Things to Do in Da Nang

This night market is ok. Check it out once but it‚Äôs not overly huge. Got a Banh Mi from a stall and it was not so good but it was only 20000 VND, just over $1 AUD so not a huge loss. It‚Äôs right next to the dragon bridge so go there on the weekend just before 9pm and see the fire display.Read more
do not buy big lobsters-the people who sold them did not cook them properly-they were raw inside and the sellers were very dishonest and rudeRead more

Place is invested with rats, litter lying around all over the place. Stay away there are many other bars and restaurants that sell good food and drinks with more affordable prices in the areaRead more

Danang city is a clean city and i am not afraid to try its night market's food. Surprisingly it is far more cheaper and delicious too. We went there almost every night to enjoy variety of local foods.Read more

Very fresh and a good variety. Deep dish pizza at Al‚Äôs, Thai, Vegetarian, Burgers, Pizza and more. Good prices, all made to order. I liked this because it wasn‚Äôt hectic and big. We loved it and chatting with the vendors. Read more

This is not a Night Market. It is basically a small food court selling mostly western style food. When I went is was empty bar two or three people. Better of going to the real Night Market by Dragon Bridge.Read more

This is a very small indoor food court, maybe ten stalls or so. One should not confuse this place with "Son Tran Night Market" which is located near the dragon bridge and is a big outdoor night market. Many of the photos you see in this TA page belongs to the Son Tra Night Market, not this place. THERE IS NO SEAFOOD HERE, if you are looking for the great seafood of Da Nang, you should go to Son Tra Night Market where you will find amazing seafood at very reasonable price. Anyway, we had delicious Banh Mis and deserts in this place.Read more

This listing is for the small indoor night market made up of mostly expats offering international food. It‚Äôs nice. The food is great and the vendors friendly. It is not the big outdoor night market near Dragon Bridge. That one is much bigger and is mostly Vietnamese vendors. Many of the reviews here confuse the two. Read more
Dinner at this place is a fun and cosy place, that can offer something for everyone. A lot of different Kitchens from all over the world who offer u a meal for a decent price.Read more

Danang night market is across the Love Bridge near the dragon head end of the Dragon Bridge. You can visit all three attractions at the same vicinity - night market, Love Bridge and Dragon Bridge.We went last Sunday night by Grab car.  It is a huge night market with a number of impressive BBQ seafood stalls, and other non-food stalls. It was crowded and noisy, a vibrant place worth going to browse around even if you are not eating there or buying anything.Read more
location: Things to Do in Da Nang

Beautiful beaches. Clean and not so crowded so relaxing so calm and refreshing. I love the white sand and the peooleRead more
just a small food market. about 8 stalls with limited seats - not very impressive. Not worth the travel, but no harm checking it out if you are nearby. Read more

Everything looked interesting and we were happy that they opened this market near Dragon Bridge. Seafood looked fresh and inviting but the vendors did theiir best to make the dinner a  nightmare. First, they asked huge prices for the food and drinks, bigger than a cosy restaurant. Secondly, after accepting  a negotiation, the quantity of food was half than what we paid for.Disgusting mode of cheating...Some of them will never learn, they will always be a " black ball" for this beautiful country with welcoming people. Fortunately, my 4 years in Vietnam helped us to get out from this bad experience. Advise:if you are not together with a local person, better don't try the food there. Read more
Lots of stalls the markets are same same but well worth a look. Great atmosphere, lots to see and take in. Right by the waterfront, nice for a stroll.Read more

The night market is great to shop and eat, it's very festive. My daughter and I went to Da Nang and we felt totally safe to be out and about at night. Just use your common sense and be careful to watch the meter in the taxis, some will try to rip you off.Read more
This is is really for the book.  The ambiance is so intimate and festive.  Can't get enough of the local food, local products, and the vibes it offered for someone far from home. Read more

We had the burritos from the Mexican stand and honestly they were delicious. I had the vegetable burrito and my partner had the chicken and we both enjoyed it. I also ordered edamame beans from a different counter as I could resist. The vibe here is good. We sat in the small courtyard to the side and really enjoyed ourselves. Would definitely recommend as there‚Äôs plenty of food options! Read more

Ok...I may be writing this in the wrong place.  We found the "real" Da Nang Night Market here.  We Googled Da Nang Night Market and I am writing this review for the market named Ch·ª£ ƒê√™m ƒê√† N·∫µng -Danang Night Market.  This market is located near the eastern foot of the Dragon Bridge.  This is NOT the An Thuong Night Market.  Unfortunately the English TripAdvisor site does not have a separate page for this night market (there does appear to be a Vietnamese language page).  This is the night market not to miss!  This Night Market was fantastic!  Not touristy at all and full of locals! (I was one of two Caucasian faces that I saw).  And the seafood that we ate at in the family run food stalls was one of the food highlights of our trip to Vietnam!  Sure, there are a lot of vendors selling junk.  There are also a number of vendors selling various  food products that seem to be for locals to take home.  But the food stalls were fantastic.  The focus was mostly on live fresh seafood seasoned and grilled to order.  While many stalls had similar offerings...the preparations seemed to vary from stall to stall.  This was a real night market!  Highly Highly recommended!Read more
It just a name is night market but it was not be like that so upset we plan to find out a danang street food but Read more
Wonderful cheap eats. no gouging the tourists at food stalls. locals and tourists pay the same price. wonderful friendly people.dont miss it.Read more
Open everyday??Read more

So this seems like a fake night market. Why anyone would want to travel to Da Nang and eat pizza and tacos is beyond me.

This was an amazing atmosphere and I met great people here. This is definitely worth a visit if you are here in Danang!! 100% recommend itüòÅüòÅüòÅRead more
Nice place, my family came here and tried many good food, such as: tacos, thailand food, pizza... and beer (7 brige, Dong Son,...)Read more
Fun market with many food and merchandise stalls.... near the Dragon Bridge another must see in Danang... nice to walk around Read more

A great experience for our first night.  Tons of neat items to bargain for and buy.  It‚Äôs amazing to see how life in this city has changed since my time here in 1971.  This place gives you a good feel for the new Da Nang.Read more

Had Gyoza, margaritas, Al's Chicago Deep Dish. Honestly this place is a really  nice escape from the same food for breakfast and lunch. Happy about the prices, everything is reasonable and the Chicago Deep Dish at Al's is a very good value for money. Check it out and support the local growing economy rather than one of the big resort places.Read more

It was not crowded in the restaurant. Thus, I liked it and the food also clean and tasty. However, if you think like a real market, you can definitely disappointed with the size of the market. It is just a small food court where you stay at. I recommend you to visit this place for a bottle of beer and snacks after having dinner. I and my husband had bottles of beers and Japanese grilled chicken, dumping and Thai food. It was yummy but I was regret not having many kinds of Vietnamese food here.It was close to MiKe beach. The location was good to enough! Read more

Waited over an hour for a single beef burrito. Seated myself directly in front of the stall, and had the joy of watching people arrive, order and receive their food while being told "10min" each time I went up to ask where my food was. I'd understand if it was a busy night, or they could not find me, but sitting there, watching, it definitely was not. Avoid if you want to eat in any reasonable timeframe.Read more
No night market but just some tourist trap restaurants. The name is deceptive, only trying to bringt tourists here.Read more

We visited this market by the dragon bridge with no great expectations...Firstly, the night views of the bridges are fantastic! Ever changing light show!The souvenir stalls are ok...but the food section was great, and very cheap.First we had a a Delat style pizza/pancake. This description isn't accurate, it's thin and crispy, with a delicious topping, cooked on charcoal then folded. Delicious, 80p each (UK)Next discovery was a seafood stall, just left of the arched lit up entry to the market. Tall skinny guy doing the cooking. Quite the best oysters and scallops we have EVER tasted! Mr Michelin should visit!! We had a plate of 6 mixed scallops and oysters cooked on a BBQ with a delicious dressing for ¬£2! They were SO delicious we went straight back for another plate! If you can find this stall you will not be disappointed!Read more

What a great little find this food market is. The food here is excellent, best pizza I have tasted in weeks.The price is very cheap.Everything is cooker fresh in front of you.There is every cuisine here so don‚Äôt be put off by other ridiculous reviews. Read more
location: Things to Do in Da Nang

DaNang is a well decorated city and known for its coconut coffee. Lots of shopping stores that gives you a flea market feeling and it‚Äôs also popular for its ancient Japanese bridge. Read more

The atmosphere of the market is lively and friendly as its full of travelers looking for conversation.   A great selection of food and drinks at good prices.  Some of the food is mediocre at best but it hits the spot with some of the old favs you might be missing.   Read more

You will find every type of food you like. Pizza at Al's Best a Pizza in Danang or Grills at Tammy's Grill. Have a few drinks with friends or family. A great break from the hustle and bustle of Vietnam. Meet locals and expats while having great food and local drinks. Read more
a nice and cool night market. located near the river, many small shops with lots of colour and light. certainly fun to walk here at night and enjoy the vibe and eat some da nang food.Read more
lots of little stall and lots of people.  gets busy and crowed you can buy food but to busy for me so i quickly strolled through and leftRead more
Such a fab market. Definitely recommend Al‚Äôs best pizza, literally was the best pizza I have ever had. Also the chilli cheese fries from the Mexican stall was amazing!Read more

Nor is this what you think it is. Just a cluster of shops, half run by foreigners doing dodgy foreign food (pizza, Russian stuff, yakitori) with overpriced beer. Not a night market per se. Just a little tourist and ex-pat enclave.Take a walk a few blocks to the south and you‚Äôll find lots of great local food, super cheap, no tourists.Read more

We would have walked right passed this one hadn‚Äôt we saw one of these puppies come out of the mini oven. We got ours to go back to the hotel on a rainy night in Da Nang. It was glorious: Chicago Deep Dish with canned tomatoes, onions, the best cheese I‚Äôve had in Viet Nam. Wow.We ordered one pizza for two people and it was really filling. We couldn‚Äôt stop eating it.Read more

If only we had listened to @GSVHanoi we would have saved ourselves a 4km round trip walk. There were hardly any vendors open and it didn't look clean. We did not eat here as thete was not a lot of choice.Read more

We had gyozas, banh mi, Wong tong noodle soup (this was freaking amazing!) & a double burger which was quite good too. Atmosphere was okay.. we went at 6:30pm and only a few tourists there.Read more

"Night Market" is a stretch!  After reading some of the previous reviews we were greatly disappointed when we finally found it.   It should have told us something when we stopped to ask some locals about the "night market" and they didn't know about it.   There were only about 5 stalls open.  Don't waste your time.   There are other streets in Da Nang that offer more.Read more

I couldnt believe how many stalls they can cramp into one complex. You must go here its an experience that you wont forget for a long time.Every conceivable shopping item is sold here, Shirts Shorts T Shirts food coffee you cant believe how busy the place is. Do your self a favour, dont miss this Markets off your shopping list. You wont regret it. Read more

I stumbled onto this place while looking for some eat.  I tried the taco at one of the 15 or somfood stalls and love them.  I‚Äôve been back and because I‚Äôve made some really great friends while eating there.  Also, a local friend invited me to meet him there and we had a blast.  We sat at the same stall at the back of the market and made all sorts of friends.  Sorry, I never made it past the tacos as they are so yummy!  I just go straight there but am sure other foods are good as well.Read more

When I heard about this night market I expected hundreds of food stalls, gift shops, etc.  What I found was maybe 15ish stalls.  It was very small and not what I expected.  Too bad really as I expected more.  Maybe it was my fault for setting my expectations of a "night market" too high.I will admit though, the food I did get (crepe and bun mi) was tasty.Read more
you can spent alot of time at here. many shop at here with local product. you can find a lot of thing at here. just visit it and enjoy the night. Read more
It was great to see that the stalls were set up and mended by young people but it is not worth the trip there. The variety is not there and it was pricey for sure.Read more
Small market for traveller in Da Nang will almost 20 booths but variety of foods you can eat hear. Tacos, Thai food, burger, cheese steak, saigon food....Read more

This is our first time for traveling to Vietnam, I'm a bit excited because many reviews on Internet it not so good , but we where there for 4 day but was very nice we went to  Danang night market it a lot of restaurants and shops and many recommendations for our food you should try.Read more

After 1 1/2 years away from quality fish and chips...i finally found some at Mr. Poe's stall at Danang night market! Very tasty fish and delicious chips! Definitely worth a visit and there are other food delights at the surrounding stalls as well!Read more
Open everyday??Read more

So this seems like a fake night market. Why anyone would want to travel to Da Nang and eat pizza and tacos is beyond me. 
Can anyone tell me where a real night market is in Da Nang? With real local street food served by locals. Thanks.Read more

It's next to Dragon Bridge. Google maps puts it to this address:
Son Tra Night Market

location: Things to Do in Da Nang

general_info: #29 of 114 things to do in Da Nang
attraction_summary: Danang Night Market is a local gathering of international food booths that offer a variety of dishesrepresenting different areas of the world. Operating every night, Danang Night Market is rich with culture and food offerings from an assortment of culinary skilled vendors. From Philly cheesesteaks to Sake bar, local craft beer (and everything in between) it is the go-to for food lovers alike.Read more
reviews:
The food is good, you can bargain for the seafood set even if they already stated the price.
They would also let you choose what kind of sauce that you want.
It is near My Khe beach so very convenient if you stay around that area.

The downside is that there are very little stalls there. Very few people walked pass but maybe more people will come late at nightRead more

What an exciting night at the Night Market ! From our hotel,  we took a ride to the night market. There were ready made dresses, souvenirs, other items and ready to eat food including fresh seafoods. We selected some fresh seafoods and had it cook based on its displayed menu. After partaking their delicious food we headed to other sections and saw assorted items for display. What fun night!
Make sure you are ready to be gastronomically adventurous as there are so much food to choose from. Just choose what you can consume üòäRead more

Fun experience if you want to just take a stroll around a night market. Advice for tourists, beware of the seafood sets at the vendors. Even if you bargained with them, you will not get the same set. Those sets are just for displays. Cheaper to just go to local seafood restaurants. Also, don‚Äôt set for the prices for clothes, toys, accessories etc. you can bargain way lower than what they marked.Read more

It's just a bunch of mini-restaurant stalls shoved into a house.  A bunch of them aren't even open.  It seems to do OK with the locals which is how I ended up here but if you are just visiting don't waste your time.  I had few enough nights, shouldn't have spent time here.Read more

Had a great feed here two nights in a row because food was so good the first night. Similar to a food-truck style food outlets for drinks and desserts. Night food market with live dj and plenty of options for dinner and open late.Plenty of varied options, fish, thai, Vietnamese, ca phe, beer, sake, burgers etc etc.  Give it a go!Read more
Though it's small... Some nice places to eat. But guess we went there too early... As there were hardly people, guess it's made for tourists and nice if u pass by if u r around my khe beach.Read more

Too small to be called night market, but passed by after got dining at other resto, still had to buy some here, cause they were good. Not many stands, but all are trying their best. So 5 star for their trying.Read more
Small but enough. First time try frog skin deep fried. It was so good. And the shocked price: 1 usd for a big dish. UnforgettableRead more

Decided to make a trip there tonight after reading some of the reviews here. Was totally disappointed when i got there. Only a handful of stores and nothing to shout about. Within 5mins I had completed the tour of the market and decided to adjourn another place for dinner. There are only a handful of stores and the night market name is quite misleading. Seriously i think it's total waste of my time there tonight. Read more
I went to a shop "TLO" in Da Nang Night Market. Tacos here is very tasty so I want everyone to eat itüåÆüòã‚ù£Ô∏èRead more

I was walking around and stumbled upon this cute little market. I bought some french pastries @ LeBordeaux : the macarons and canel√©s were wonderful, as good as those I had in Paris ! I did not buy anything else, but the other booths seemed to make very nice dishes ! I recommend to stop by, settle down with some friends for an hour and enjoy the   atmosphere there. Read more

I ended up in this night market following some friends, great place if you don't know what to eat at night. Plenty of choices from tacos and cajun shrimps to Belgian waffles. After eating, we stopped by the small bar with the 10 shots challenge, great place to have fun with a group of friends. Overall, I loved the atmosphere of the night market, the only downside is that it could be a little bit bigger.Read more
A great little night market with a variety of international and local foods. Have tried almost all of it over a few night and everything is top quality! Read more

I came here once and I think it's good night market. Great food and drink around there. Cool thing abt this place is the Japanese liquor shop. I pretty like that Ume drink it's sweet and absolutely good to me. And if you ever come there don't for her to try Tacos in there. It's amazingly stunning. They only have flour Tacos but however the meet and the sauce are seriously delightful and freshly.I definitely will come back if I have a chance.Read more

The night market is just what the An Thuong area needs. Great food and vibe!  Lots of interesting local and international foods to try. Good options for drinking too; 7 Bridges has a booth and check out the best bartender in town at the saki bar in the back!  Definitely a must stop while in Danang!Read more

This night market in the heart of Da Nang's tourist district has awesome foods that are prepared with high quality ingredients. I think it may be because most stalls are run by expats that have brought their own culinary ways and tastes. The market is upkept and clean with a very quaint atmosphere. My family spent a week in Da Nang and we came here every night haha so much delicious foods to chose from! Our kids especially loved the lovely Banh Xeo stall! I didn't chose the banh xeo life, the banh xeo life chose me!Read more

Great vibes where most of the food is cooked in front of you. From tacos to Fresh Shrimps  and Thai food to French patisseries, banh xeo etc...! Really amazing place for those who struggles in deciding what to eat!Read more
We tasted Belgian waffles, tacos, hot dogs, french fries and ice cream and everything was delicious! There was also live music on sunday night when we were visiting  Read more
Great night market in An thuong area. Many kind of foods ( Vietnamese, Thai, Tacos, cheese steak... and more) . Very highly recommended!Read more
The market is located near the beach,I liked the variety of food from french to vietnamese and mexican. Its open until late, good option for late snack in an thuong area.Read more

An Thuong Night Market is one of my favorite places to go in the evening in Da Nang, there are good products here, and especially the food here is both delicious and cheap, a place that I think is touristy. Every schedule must come here at least onceRead more

A very small night market with very little offer, a couple of massage stalls, and five or six food stalls, designed by and for the tourist, among the few people there were no Vietnamese who passed by here on different days.Read more

The advertised Da Nang night market is no longer thereAt least not where it used to be!!There are only old signs from the old days.Now you can find it about 100 m further along the main road, but with very little on offer.It was more than disappointing and will certainly take some time to rebuild.Read more

The big spiny lobster was very delicious.I went there two days.On the first day, I ordered by pointing at a restaurant with a normal menu with prices. I was surprised at the amount of food, which was like a yellow egg roll with shrimp. It came with rice paper and leafy vegetables to eat with it.The person next to me was eating it with gusto, so I decided to try shrimp tomorrow.On the second day, the lady at the middle store gave me a set of two spiny lobsters, regular shrimp, and shellfish for 450KD, so I ordered that. I ordered the regular shrimp with garlic margarine and the spiny lobster with mayonnaise. It came with shellfish and octopus. The spiny lobster is a bargain compared to Japan. The meat was packed even down to the legs, so it was satisfying to eat. It was bland, so they would give you soy sauce, fish sauce, etc. if you ask. I ordered it well done. Drinks were 25KD beer and 35KD strawberry shake. After that, I was full after eating grilled yakitori and corn for 20KD, two bottles of beer, and sugar cane juice for 20KD. They served me fried water spinach for free. It was delicious with garlic and chili pepper seasoning.Read more
Exciting and fun with lots of delicious food and drink. The price is a bit high so deducting 1 star, walking around and visiting is sparkling.Read more
location: Things to Do in Da Nang

The Da Nang Street Market is really underwhelming. There isn't much variety of food vendors, the prices for everything are really high, everyone is hassling you to buy from their stall, the quality of the food is not good, and it's very crowded with tourists. Maybe stop by if you need to kill time before seeing the dragon bridge show, but it's really not worth your time or money to go this night market.Read more

This was the most unpleasant and aggressive experience I had in Vietnam. Constant bombardment of vendors trying to get your attention. Now I know how Christ must have felt at the Temple in Jerusalem. Avoid at all costs. It‚Äôs not cheap and so not worth your time. Horrible experience.Read more

The the best seafood with huge lobsters and shrimps at a very good price the Night market in DaNang is must do. It is just over the dragon bridge with many venders with great fresh seafood and other venders with all sorts of local souvenirs.Read more

Went to the night market after the Dragon bridge show. Didn't even stay as it was super touristy, pretty expensive for a night market and you were hassled everywhere you walked. Didn't get a single thing to eat. Super dissapointedRead more

Not worth a visitFood was all heavily friend or seafood that would have been out of fridge all day Don‚Äôt risk the food poisoning Other stuff for sale us seriously same same Water 25,000 instead of 10,000 in a Danang convenience storeRead more

We spent two nights here total. The first night was on a weeknight, it was less crowded. The market has many vendors which included food, goods from China, massage vendors. The first night we tried a few items that were decent. There was a lady who gave me some juice that was supposed to be cane but it was not. Didn‚Äôt want to make a big fuss about it so we left. It tasted decent, but I knew it was not cane juice. We got two b√°nh m√¨ sandwiches that were good. We got squid on a skewer which was decent as well. We saw lobster and seafood vendor and the Lady was really nice. She had very good sauce so we wanted to come back because at that point we were already full. Two nights later, we went to the same vendor and she sold us a tray that costed 800,000 dong. However, she told us to sit somewhere further out, and she did not bring us all that we ordered. She did not give us the same sauce, and her attitude was very different after we were sold. Many of the vendors Are not honest and want to raise their prices and not give you what you ask for. This has been a common theme throughout our trip unfortunately. The raise of the price for foreigners.Read more

We spent few hours in an evening, had BBQ seafood and bought some clothing. There are many BBQ seafood stall to pick from, for about S$28 we get a plater or two medium size lobster, some squids, prawns and clams BBQ and served on those low tables and chairs on the sides, good for an experience eating this manner, but how food were prepared, and cook may make some wondered if they will be fine :)Other items on sale are the same of most places, but it seems this place has low tolerance for bargaining.The place is comparatively more spacious and cleaner than those one may find in such places as Taiwan and Malaysia.Read more
